name: 行為生態學
description: Behavioral ecology is the study of why animals behave the way they do. It focuses on understanding how biotic and abiotic environments can interact to shape an individual’s behavior. Students will be introduced to some of the main topics in behavioral ecology. They will also be trained to propose and evaluate hypotheses about the adaptive value of animals’ behavioral decisions and to design experiments to test between these hypotheses.
goals: Lectures and reading assignments will introduce students to some of the main topics in behavioral ecology
In-class discussion of research papers will improve students’ ability to think critically
syllabus:
Week1: Class Introduction

Week2: Natural selection, ecology and behavior

Week3: Testing hypotheses in behavioral ecology

Week4: Economic decisions and the individual

Week5: Predators vs. prey

Week6: Competing for resources

Week7: Living in groups

Week8: Sexual selection

Week9: ExamI

Week10: Parental care and family conflicts

Week11: Mating systems

Week12: Sex allocation

Week13: Social behaviors

Week14: Cooperation

Week15: Altruism and conflict in the social insects

Week16: Communication and signals

Week17: Conclusion

Week18: ExamII
